intro: Chrysanthemum subcorymbosum, commonly known as the clustered chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including yellow, white, and pink, and are often used in ornamental gardening. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to gardens.
